title: Clinical data template for a summary table of the data
description: This report summarizes the data of interest (with the \code{inTextSummaryTable} package). This table is displayed with an interactive table in the report, and exported to a docx file. This table can be compared to a summary table of a previous batch ('comparisonTable' parameters).

templatePackage.doc: package from which the template should be extracted

dataFileName.doc: name of the data file of interest

dataTotalProcessing.doc: data processing parameters for 'dataTotalFileName', passed to \link[clinDataReview]{processData}

tableParams.doc: parameters to summarize the data in a table, passed to \link[inTextSummaryTable]{computeSummaryStatisticsTable}

tableParamsDocx.doc: parameters to format the table to the docx format, passed to \link[inTextSummaryTable]{exportSummaryStatisticsTable}

tableParamsDT.doc: parameters to format the table to the DT interactive table included in the report, passed to \link[inTextSummaryTable]{exportSummaryStatisticsTable}

comparisonTableType.doc: output type of the comparison table

for 'table-comparison-interactive': the summary statistics are computed, and then compared, 'newData-diff': the differences at a record level between the new and old batch are first identified, and then summarized

comparisonTableParams.doc: parameters for the comparison table, passed to \link[clinUtils]{compareTables}. By default, statistics variables are compared across row and column elements.

loopingVar.doc: data variable(s) to loop over, for which each output should be created

loopingNMax.doc: maximum number of elements of \code{loopingVar} to include in the report

loopingTotal.doc: should the total also be computed by \code{loopingVar} (TRUE by default)?
